title: Have your say: Is this the dirtiest Rugby World Cup ever? And if so, what needs to change?
text:
With five red cards to its name, the 2019 Rugby World Cup already boasts the record for the most dismissals at a World Cup - and there are still close to 20 games to be played.

Tomas Lavanini’s high-tackle on Owen Farell during England’s 39-10 victory over Argentina at the Ajinomoto stadium on Saturday raised a number of eyebrows, and has had some questioning why players are struggling to get to grips with tackling law changes made earlier this year.

Telegraph readers have had their say on why there have been so many red cards at this summer’s tournament in Japan, as well as offering insight on whether new tackling laws have had a negative impact on the game.

'Failure to change will hurt'

...
description: With five red cards to its name, the 2019 Rugby World Cup already boasts the record for the most dismissals at a World Cup - and there are still close to 20 games to be played.
